meanings.definition: A person who adheres strictly to a rubric or set of rules.
meanings.sent1: The teacher, a dedicated rubricians, always followed the grading guidelines precisely.
meanings.sent2: The rubricians carefully checked each box on the assessment form.
meanings.sent3: The rubricians at the competition made sure every detail was in order, even the font size!
meanings.sent4: She was a true rubricians, treating the recipe like a sacred text to be followed exactly.
meanings.sent5: The rubricians' commitment to the rules was unwavering, like a compass pointing due north.

meanings.definition: The act of following a rubric or set of rules.
meanings.sent1: The rubricians of the group ensured that every step was completed as per the instructions.
meanings.sent2: Following the rubricians of the game, he moved his piece according to the rules.
meanings.sent3: The rubricians of the dance routine were so precise that they even synchronized their smiles.
meanings.sent4: In the world of coding, following the rubricians of syntax is crucial for error-free programs.
meanings.sent5: The rubricians of etiquette dictated that one should always say 'please' and 'thank you'.
